title: Accessibility statement for the court and tribunal hearings service

section1.text1: This accessibility statement applies to content published on
section1.text2: The court and tribunal hearings service provides a publishing platform to enable information, such as hearing lists, provided by HM Courts and Tribunals Service (HMCTS) to be shared, displayed and updated as appropriate. It will enable information to be displayed to court users, consistent with jurisdictional procedures and business rules. The service supports HMCTS’ commitment to open justice and the provision of transparent and consistent court and tribunal information across jurisdictions.
section1.text3: This website is run by HMCTS. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website, so we have designed it to be accessible. For example, that means you should be able to:
section1.text4: We’ve also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.

zoom in up to 400% without the text spilling off the screen
navigate most of the website using a keyboard or speech recognition software

section2.heading: How accessible this website is
text: Whilst most hearing lists within the service are accessible, some hearing lists are only presented and viewable as a PDF or word document (flat files). These can be difficult for screen reader users to navigate as the content is untagged, untitled and the tables are not marked up to enable screen reader users to navigate and identify the information correctly.

The availability of these hearing lists in a flat file only format is under continuous review and in the future may be published as fully accessible lists. As a contingency lists may be published as a flat file should integrations from source systems fail.

section3.heading: Feedback and contact information
text1: We provide a text relay service for people who are D/deaf, hearing impaired or have a speech impediment.
Our courts and tribunals have audio induction loops, or if you contact us before your visit we can arrange a British Sign Language (BSL) interpreter.
Find out how to contact us by using the contact details below.
If you need information on this website in a different format like accessible PDF, large print, easy read or braille, please contact:
section3.text2: We'll consider your request and get back to you within 10 working days.

section5.text1: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’). If you’re not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the

section6.heading: Technical information about this website’s accessibility
section6.text1: HMCTS is committed to making its websites accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.

section8.preamble: The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.
text: Some hearing lists presented within the service are presented and viewable only as PDF or word document (flat files). This means that assistive technology users may struggle to review and understand the pdfs. This fails WCAG 2.2 success criterion 1.3.1 (info and relationships).

Page titles are not specific to the content on the screen and do not have enough information. This could be confusing for screen reader users as they wouldn’t be aware of what page they are on when they land on it. This fails WCAG 2.2 success criterion 2.4.2 (page titled). We plan to resolve this issue by the end of April 2025.

section9.heading: What we’re doing to improve accessibility
text: We have actively engaged with jurisdictions across HMCTS to make sure that source systems produce accessible documents for publishing. We have asked services to review future enhancements when producing documents to make them fully accessible.
We will also continually run automated accessibility testing as part of our development practices.
Progress will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, with the continuation of internal and external audits.

section10.heading: Preparation of this accessibility statement
text: This statement was prepared on 8 September 2023. It was last reviewed on 06 March 2025.
This website was last audited by the HMCTS accessibility testing team in the Testing Centre of Excellence on 18 November 2024 across a range of assistive technologies and automated tools.
